etymology.description: 音(音) (yīn, 'sound') + 心(心) (xīn, 'heart') = sound in the heart -> concept of thought and intention
etymology.interpretation: The character 意(yì) represents abstract concepts of thought, intention, and meaning by combining elements symbolizing sound and heart, reflecting processed sensory input and emotional response.

examples.chinese: 他的意思很明确(他的意思很明確)。
我有一个好主意(我有一個好主意)，想改变现状(想改變現狀)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yǒu yīgè hǎo zhǔyì, xiǎng gǎibiàn xiànzhuàng.
examples.english: I have a good idea and want to change the current situation.

examples.chinese: 他的用意并非恶意(他的用意並非惡意)。
